pkgmetadata.longdescription: Oblique Decision Random Forest for Classification and Regression // The oblique decision tree (ODT) uses linear combinations of predictors as partitioning variables in a decision tree. Oblique Decision Random Forest (ODRF) is an ensemble of multiple ODTs generated by feature bagging. Both can be used for classification and regression as supplements to the classical CART of Breiman (1984) https://imsarchives.nus.edu.sg /oldwww/Programs/014swclass/files/mark.pdf and Random Forest of Breiman (2001) DOI:10.1023/A:1010933404324 respectively.
